human procreation
instincts lust is as old as Humanity

essential need to reproduce it's
Nature's Way of ensuring the survival of

evolutionary psychology suggests that
our ancestors who were more driven by

and passing on their genes even though
Society has evolved these instincts
remain deeply embedded in our psyche
often surfacing in ways that can
sometimes feel overwhelming or

substances do research published in
Nature Neuroscience shows that when you
have lustful thoughts your brain
releases dopamine the neurotransmitter
associated with pleasure and reward this
creates a cycle in which your brain
starts seeking more of the same
stimulation reinforcing lustful
Behavior Number Four lust creates
Illusions our brains are wired to

shown that when we view stimulating

up creating an illusion where the visual
seems more appealing than
reality for example in a study published
in the journal Neuroscience participants

individuals and brain scans revealed

response can make us overestimate the
attractive or desirability of what we
see leading to unrealistic expectations
in real life

studies from the Journal of sex research

why lust can be misleading masking
deeper more meaningful connections

shape
